question: Which country was the location of the protests "Girls of Enghelab Street"?
explanation: Iran was the location of the protests "Girls of Enghelab Street". Girls of Enghelab Street was a series of protests against compulsory hijab in Iran. The protests were inspired by Vida Movahed, an Iranian woman is known as the Girl of Enghelab Street, who stood in the crowd on a utility box in the Enghelab Street (Revolution Street) of Tehran on 27 December 2017, tied her hijab, a white headscarf, to a stick, and waved it to the crowd as a flag.
